comment1: 38 years old, hanging in there. The kid who played these games is still here.
comment2: I was 13 years old. It was Christmas Eve 1995. I remember getting up around 7 am and played this game before I went to my grandma's for Christmas. It reminds me of better, simpler times.
comment3: I remember playing this game when I was a kid and my dad was dying of lung cancer. This specific level’s soundtrack touched me then and it still effects me to this day. So a work of art my heart is singing to this melody.
comment4: It reminds me of my homie Max who passed away twenty years ago. We played the game every day. Rest in Peace Max. I hope, that we will see us again on the other side.
comment5: I remember this track. This reminds me of being a kid again, I’m 35 now married with a house and puppies. Sometimes it’s scary to realize how time keeps going and doesn’t stop for anyone. I hope everyone listening to this and reading the comments grows old, happy and healthy.
comment6: Im passing through hard times rn. Divorce, my children going to live with the mother, I might comeback to my mother´s house, felling the depression symptons coming back also. Its not easy, but for some reason, when I start to listening to this song, everything gets better. It send me back on time. Just me, my SNES and happy moments. I have faith that one day things will get better
comment7:
This might sound strange for some but I think the awe and nostalgic feeling this beautiful music brings forth on people actually helps coping with the inevitability of growing older and even death.
Quoting from a wise person who once said: "Don't be sad that it's over. Be happy that it happened."
comment8: This track reminds me when all i looked forward to was waiting for weekend to go blockbuster i was in middle school, i remember i would find peace playing snes being that my older brother was invovled with a street gang in los angeles during the 1990s gang murder rates were all time high! He would tell play your snes im gonna go hangout with the homeboys ill see you tomorrow, i would just start playing snes and then pray my older brother doesnt get life in prison or get murdered, All this was back in 1997. My older brother is a engineer now and he changed his life in 2003 and has 4 great intelligent kids the oldest is almost finished with college. I am also father and succesful.
comment9: Even though I didn't exist when this game was popular, this song still brings back childhood memories. :)
comment10: This song always reminds me of my dad... I was just a kid and everything was so easy. Even to ignore some feelings. Now, years after both the happy days of my childhood and the passing of someone that was so important to me as my father was, I can see that our lives are so short and that only time can make us realize some important moments that otherwise in other moment would be just...normal. I miss my father and I miss the old times...
comment11: I was 5 years old and would run into my family game room and watch my dad play and watch my brothers watching him and cheering him on and I remember only wishing I could play too instead of appreciating what I had in front of me at the time. Rip
comment12: God, I need to spend more time with my Dad...
comment13: I want my family to play this song at my funeral.
comment14: Life hurts these days, good to know I can revisit something that brought me the joy I had in my innocence. David Wise an absolute unit of a 90's composer
comment15: Been feeling really down today about my last relationship. 6 1/2 years and a promised marriage, gone. I knew in my heart he wouldn't be the man I needed. If we ever had kids he would of neglected them. This song helps me cry it out.

comment1: My uncle bought my brother and I this game for Christmas 1999. I wasn’t good at it so I just enjoyed watching my brother play it almost every day after school. I don’t think he ever beat the 2 save files that he had saved, mine being the 3rd. He passed away this past spring at 29 years old, and while I don’t have the cartridge back yet I’ll be damned if I don’t finally finish this game for the two of us.
comment2: “Time passes, people move. Like a river's flow, it never ends. A childish mind will turn to noble ambition. Young love will become deep affection.”
comment3: This is the exact meaning of “Don’t cry because it’s over, smile because it happened”
comment4: Being a kid or a teenager in the late 90s was pure magic my people.
comment5: RIP brother you will be surely missed and loved forever. 1990-2022.
comment6: This song is just full of sadness and magic at the same time it makes me cry. This game is the reason why my little brother and I got into The Legend of Zelda. Reminds me of the beautiful memories that my little brother and I shared together when we were young. I miss him so much, I hope he’s happy and i hope he can forgive me for all the bad times we had. We’ve had so many good times, but they’re just at times painful to look back on. I love you so much little brother, everyday I have to wake up to silence and an empty bed. I can only find you in my memories and in our childhood video games.
comment7: I remember a few years back me and my dog were on the porch listening to this. It was just a nice little moment between the two of us . Its been three months since he was put to sleep. I miss you stryker
comment8: This song is turning everyone into a philosopher
comment9: Instantly cried when I heard this. This game blew my mind as an adolescent. Great memories.
comment10:
the players will change while the game stays the same.
this is what listening to this timeless track makes me feel.
comment11: why does it hurt hearing this? Its such a beautiful song.
comment12: The best thing about going back to this game 24 years later? When your children ask to play this alongside you and they enjoy it just as much as you did when you were their age. That for me, completes the nostalgia I feel whenever I play these classics.
comment13: I wasn't born until 2003. But God damn this is the most nostalgic thing to me. Makes me cry almost.  This game means everything to me
comment14: This song makes me feel like I’m in a field of grass. The sun is great, the roses smell good as ever, the trees wave at me, the blue sky surrounds me, and I also see a bunny hopping it’s way to who knows. Like all my life problems just went away.
comment15: Flawless and beautiful… I never really appreciated this as a child

comment1: This song is beautiful and brings out so many elements and aspects and can be interpreted in so many ways... it just puts me at peace
comment2: To everyone in the comments. I don't know you and you don't know me but this song makes me feel feelings. comment3: Wow... this came on by accident. I knew instantly what it was and it hit home. The nostalgia poured in so quick. These were the days. <3

comment5: A picture holds a thousand words, a song holds a million memories, this games holds my childhood
comment6: I would just sit in the loading screen and listen to this song over and over as a kid. Be care free and not have to worry about the hardships that we'll face in life... all that was on our minds was beating KH together.
comment7: Still remember that magical feel you got the first time you put in that disc in the PS2 and soon got to heard this beautiful theme for the first time ever.
comment8: I remember getting this back in 2002.  It was one of the best days of my life.  I remember staying home sick one day and then beating the game, and that song that was playing while you were watching those clips of what happened in the worlds you visited.  It brought tears to my eyes and still does.  Kingdom Hearts is the only game so far to do that to me.
comment9: I love how you can hear the waves in the background. It's so relaxing...
comment10:

comment11: Oh God!! the Nostalgia is coming out of my eyes in the form of water! Such a melancholic and beautiful melody.
comment12: Oh man the song just gives me a wave of emotions and makes me want to remember each moment of it.
comment13: I remember playing the first game in my basement eight years ago...I was twelve...a young child with the entire world in my sights. This song brings back more than just memories of a game...it brings me back to a time where there was no need for a job, college, bills, bullshit. This game will forever be linked to my childhood. Who knew a simple tune could nearly bring a person to tears...
comment14: damn this takes me back. my cousin used to live at my house and she had this game, she would tell me not to watch her playing it because of the violence and i was so young. but when she moved out she forgot to take the game, and i played it. i got so into it, it's such a beautiful game. then, one time i played this tune on a piano for her, and was like "remember this?" and she was surprised. she had no idea how i knew the tune. lol
comment15: This song is my lullaby. I don't know why. It still is! ...

comment1: Checkpoint: Here I am, in my thirties, listening to this song again, from a game that marked a generation and that makes me think about going back in time to today! My life was one of the best, but today depression takes over, sometimes I try to recover, but not everyone around me wants peace. Someday I will come back here to write that everything worked out and that I overcame depression!
comment2: This song... The time machine that takes me back to the past its so powerful ♥️ love chrono trigger
comment3: everytime I hear this song I always remember when my little sister was still alive.. haha such good memories
comment4: This takes me back …
comment5: Don't let your bitterness cloud the beauty or hope from vision, especially if that bitterness is well earned.
comment6: My funeral song put this itch on loop!
comment7: It is a Monday.  I'm listening to a song many years older than I am. I am feeling nostalgic for a time u have yet to experience.  I feel like I was born right when everything went to shit. I'm now going to start college in a month. Amendments are being repealed,  schools are being shot up, and the world is heating up. It feels like there is no longer anything positive In this world. Sometimes it makes you want to give up, but tomorrow comes. It always does, because it must. Never give up, because it can't get worse than it is right now.
comment8: I'm 26 here in Australia drinking by myself because my life's a mess, i guess it's time to clean it up
comment9: Beautiful piece of music. there is a sadness in it that works as a function to portray the tragedy and state of zeal, an ideological "utopia" that existed at the expense of all the inhabitants below.
comment10: Rest in peace, Taia777. o7
comment11:
It's a Tuesday.  I sit here writing this, feeling a sense of deja vu. College could be going better, but it could be going a lot worse. I have never cared about March in my entire life, and now it's all I look forward to. When you have some9ne to love, you change. I have never missed anyone more than my partner, and while I will see them in 11 days, it feels like a Lifetime away. 

Never give up
comment12: Age 29. Just had a physical and I'm over 30kg overweight; I can't drive yet so I can't be with my partner of 7 years in person; I'm working a job with limited move-up... Despite these facts, I'm going to go into this new era of my life fighting for it.
comment13: bring me to 1995!!!!
comment14: Checkpoint: 3/6/23. 24 years old. I first listened to this song when I was still in college. I was in a shitty relationship, I was depressed, and struggling with my classes. That was around three years ago. Today, I am so much happier. I found the right medication and therapy to treat my depression, I'm happily single, I have a good job, and a house! It's kind of lonely though, all my friends moved away post-college, I feel kind of isolated. Things aren't perfect but I never knew I could feel this light. Here's hoping things get even better next time around.
comment15: Im a 19, soon turning 20 year old trans guy. a friend of mine pointed me to this video, saying it felt like a theme song for if life had a literal pause menu. i feel like i'm in that pause menu right now. i have adhd and depression, and i often forget to take my meds. when that happens the world turns into a timeless slog. there's a larger "pause" as well, i feel like i'm behind on everything- registering for college classes, getting a job, learning to drive, finding a doctor to start my transition- and i don't know how to "unpause". i'm afraid i'll stay stuck this way forever.

comment1: First listened to this song durning middle school when my friend brought over Katamari one time. So touching, still makes me cry sometimes when I hear it. This song inspired me to learn Japanese. Now I’m almost 30, live in Japan, and I see all the things I used to roll up and turn into stars. Funny how life goes sometimes. I also majored Astrophysics which, come to think of it, is quite fitting.
comment2: My father showed this song to me like 3 years ago and we played katamari together after he showed me this song I'm so glad we have gotten more close together I never had someone like him he actually gives me good advice we always play games together we are closer than ever he's my only friend because I don't have any he helps me cope and things like that I love you dad :)
comment3:
This game is a cherished part of my childhood...

Whenever my older cousin would come over I would get really excited when we would play this together. She was a lot older than me (about a decade more), so she ended up moving away to California not too long after and I never get to see her anymore. Now, listening to this song reminds me of her. I hope she’s doing well and I can see her again some day... something about it kind of makes me want to cry. But... in a bittersweet kind of way? like a crying, but smiling, thinking of the memories way...
comment4: No one can deny it. There is a beauty to things that don't last forever. A sadness for the impermanence of things.. But a happiness to feel that we all were able to witness and experience it. To cherish those fleeting dreams.. And to appreciate them for what they were. Such is life. So.. To those out there reading this: Keep on rolling. Reach for your dreams that lay beyond the stars. No matter what happens.. It'll be okay. It will be okay.
comment5:
Its a very Buddhist theme of balance. Its like we want be with people we love some times. That's sad. But the best thing will always be to let go and wish them the best. Yes its lonely, but it doesn't mean we can't be happy. 

Just like a song can be deep but also just a fun song on a video game.
comment6:
This song is about two lovers. The singer is singing about how it's in her lover's nature to roll and wander around, and eventually apart from her. She accepts this and waits for her lover, because she knows that her lover will always

eventually

come

rolling

back

to her.
comment7: I have never played this game... but I still have nostalgia for it. Through the music alone.
comment8: This is strangely calming, it's not happy but it's not sad... It's simply serene.....
comment9:
I always loved this song from the original Katamari game I grew up playing with my father and sister. Recently I moved overseas to properly start my solo life far from home... And now re-listening to it and re-discovering the lyrics, I just can't help but calling them and catching up with them.

The lyrics "Now, face forward and go" (Saa, Mae wo muite ikou),  "Don't give up, alright?" (Akiramenaideyo, ne?) and "Gimme a call sometimes"(Tama ni wa denwa shite) especially pull on the heart strings.
comment10: Me and my best friend went half and half on this game on release without knowing what it was. This song has stuck with me for over half my life.
comment11: I’m listen to this when I’m on the verge of losing it.
comment12: I'm is aware that I need to let her go but a little part of me is still attached to the idea of her someday returning... I truly believe that life is just about rolling with people but always be aware that at the end of the day you need to roll things alone, so you are constantly a Lonely Rolling Star... It's been really difficult for me to overcome this broken heart, but until the next person arrives, ill be rolling by myself :)
comment13: I’ll never forget the day when I first sat down to play Katamari and this song came on. It was the first time I went and bought an actual sound track to a video game. Damn, that was like 13 years ago...

Shows you how powerful music is and how no matter what language you speak, music will touch you all in the same

comment4:
I remember as a kid I played a lot of video games on the Wii and GameCube but it really took me a long time to realize how hard the music slapped back then. I wish I could enjoy those days when I didn't have to worry about things like the Pythagorean theorem, macroeconomics, biology, literature and philosophy and German and just embrace the times I spent playing Brawl and other games on Wii remote and nunchuck sitting behind my older brothers on stools in our room as I get destroyed and still loved that time.
Although sounding corny, now I'm just a sad and empty vessel of what I was.
comment5: “Don’t cry because it’s over. Smile because it happened.”

comment7: You're 9 years old, Brawl has been out for a month or two now and you've acquired a bunch of trophies over that time. Friday comes, you get home from school, and immediately run to power on your Nintendo Wii and boot up Brawl. You head to the trophy gallery and admire the ones you've unlocked so far, reading some of the descriptions with this tune playing in the background. You can smell dinner being prepared in the kitchen as time gets away from you and the sun starts to set. Life is good, and you stop for a moment to appreciate just how beautiful the simplest things can be.

comment1:
I'm 28 now. I remember coming onto this video when I was about 18 and going through the struggles of coming of age, remembering being eight years old and playing Pokemon. I wasn't ready to accept that it was part of a bygone era of my childhood. Ten years passed then, ten years have passed again. That struggle seems so far away now, and adulthood doesn't hurt like it did when I was going through those growing pains. 
Never forget that feeling of being a child and discovering things for the first time. There's so much more to life you
comment2:
I was only 17, trying to relive a time where I could feel happiness while in a raging war against depression, a fight that would ultimately lead me to try and take my own life in my high school bathroom. My life wasn't horrible, but I was in an abusive relationship, my grades kept slipping, and I felt like I was drowning in emotions I couldn't understand, as I struggle to grasp the mental conditions that forced their way up as I grew. The song wasn't the same, but the comfort was still there. And I would retreat to the original Gold just to hear the song that made me feel peace as a little kid.

I am now 28. I am nowhere near where I hoped I'd be as an adult, but I still have things I never thought I'd have when I was 17. A wife, a condo I just bought, and my first kid on his way. Even at 28 I'm still terrified of what life will be like, and how much more I'll have to grow as an adult to provide for my family. But I hear this song, and 20 years later, the peace still remains.
comment3: Reading the comments while this music plays in the background really hits me in the feels
comment4: im 29 now and had a deep cry today remembering my grandma who passed from covid. she brought me my first gameboy color and gold version for my 8th birthday.
comment5: The past may be forever gone, but it lives through the memories we will never forget.
comment6: im just a 13 year old kid, my life is sad most of the time, and i know people have it way harder then me. ive been bullied alot and im a social outcast, i only have two friends and one of them is popular. and despite all of this, when i listen at this music for a RPG game meant for 10 year olds, i feel complete and better. i think about how middle school drama doesnt matter in my future life. i should just live my life to the fullest, and be a good person. this music made me cry
comment7:
Wow, am I an adult already? 

It feels like yesterday that I got my Gameboy Advanced and only had Pokemon Gold and Red. This music subconsciously brings a tear to my eyes. Time sure flies, huh? 

I miss being a kid, man. It was so much simpler...
comment8:
As an adult at 29 years.
This hit's me as the ten year old boy i was.

You may call it stupid.
But never forget what kind of music that hit you when you where young.
It will never fade away.
Never  forget what you where as a child.

Nintendo will always make you as the child youy where.
It will never  leave you, so the way you want to forget it.
comment9: I used to just go to the park in real life, go to National Park in the game & then sit there & look up at the sky
comment10: this will absolutely be one of the songs on my funeral playlist.  it's been in my head since i was like 6, it seems fitting.
comment11: For those scared of time itself and growing up, progression never dies, we can always hold onto the past.
comment12: I remember first hearing this song on a cool night, eating pizza in a hotel by the beach with my family. We took those nights for granted. Now here I am, almost 20 years later, thinking back to nights like those and wishing I could experience them all over again.
comment13: I'm a kid here and reading all of these comments of older adults listening and playing Pokemon gold when they were children. It sounds so heartwarming, and the way that the music has so much feeling to it... its just so sweet how a certain audio can make people remember good memories <3
comment14: Beautiful music and memories. Don't let it die, play them again, relive this moment with the adult consciousness. I'm 29, teach martial arts, and every year I play an old pokemon game during summer holidays. This year is Crystal time.
comment15:
I am passing through a stressful part of my life, specially at work. I really miss the good old days when I was a kid and my only worry was school, I was happy and I didn't know it...
But even if I had the chance, I wouldn't go back to the past. I'm glad that my childhood happened. And that's the magic behind childhood, not living it, but remembering.
Nostalgia is such a deep feeling.

comment1:
This song has so much meaning to me. The memories of me and my mom playing this game together, over and over. One of the very few games she enjoyed.
Sadly she passed away when I was 18. We had like a "funeral party", and I had to chose a song that plays when all of us walked into the church. It was this song that I chose, an emotional roller coaster. I don't even know why I'm typing this in a Youtube comment section. 


Anyways, regardless of my story, this is a beautiful song.
comment2: This was my cousin's favorite trippy song. I just came back from his funeral. May you rest in peace Vitor, I love you and will carry you with me for all my life
comment3: I don’t think people truly understand the chokehold nostalgia can have on a person. Sounds, music, smells, foods. It all just transports us back to happier, simpler times. And this song does it.

comment2: I’m 34 and crying as I listen . Takes me back to simpler times as a kid , just chilling with my brother not a care in the world .
comment3:
To me, I can relate to that feeling of loneliness, I think we all can, from one point in our lives or another. Through the venture of life, we feel often feel alone, tackling those obstacles by ourselves as time moves on. Super Mario 64's narrative captures that venture, and in a sense this crazy world we play in seems more real to us than we could have imagined.

Personally, I think this theme epitomises that feeling of loneliness, and adventuring through life alone, and rather perfectly at that.
comment4: hearing this makes me want to be a little kid again. no stress, just me my best buds and my n64. good times, I miss the 90s.
comment5: It makes me want to cry when I hear this beautiful theme. I miss my sister. 07/10/1973 - 06/012020
comment6: Time slips out of our hands. People change. Brands come and go. Companies go bankrupt. Technology advances. Consoles die. Fandoms peter out. Memories fade.
comment7: I cannot not cry when I hear this… I played this game in 90s, I’m 30 years old and today I can say this is the best game I ever played, the water level, the ship, bowser, metal level (when you could have metal mario don’t remember the name) snow level, mushroom level, the painting, et the sky level, going up and exploring the mansion, being scared of the infinite stair (because you didn’t unlock it) with the sound, wooooow , writing this seriously… also at this time my grandmother was still Alive, seriously it’s just a beautiful game
comment8: I wanna be in 1990s so bad. Children looks so innocent and happy. We all acted our ages.
comment9:
This music always brings tears to my eyes... 
My ex girlfriend played this music on the piano and I was sitting next to her listening to her playing…
I could spend hours listening to it so much I found it beautiful…
Some time she stopped and looked at me with a beautiful smile... 
But she had to go to Japan to continue her studies... 
She told me that she was finally going to live there since this is the better for her and realize her dreams... 
I will surely never see her again but this music always brings me back memories so good and sweet... 
Thank you for reading this comment ^^
comment10: This song feels comforting yet moody...just like this longing for the warmth & wonder of your childhood that is just out of reach. Longing for a world different than you had imagined. Just makes me appreciate the sacrifice my family made for me to have these memories.
comment11: This is cheesy as hell, but after I tried to take my life as a teen, all I could remember was this. The freedom I felt when listening as a child. The curiosity it sparked within me. The pure joy it brought me. I told myself I want to feel like that more. If I hadn't have has this as a child, I don't know if I could have found the hope to continue.
comment12: I still see myself as a kid sitting on the bare ground, playing this fantastic game on some chunky, square TV. This soundtrack always triggers a bittersweet,  calming nostalgia!
comment13: every time i hear this im instantly transported back to playing mario 64 as a kid. its a warm blanket. this song is the 90's. its beautiful.

This music brings back the sense of being in that same world again after all the years. Nostalgia is a very powerful feeling.

comment1: This sounds like someone who's life's fading away and they're seeing the happiest moments of their lives

comment4: Just a year back I saw Nostalgia as a happy thing, calming me down in bad moods. But going through bad times, Nostalgia is different, it really hurts, terribly. The past needs to eventually be left behind, but in times like this, it's just so hard to do that. I will never forget my history, especially with this game.

comment3: This song really gets to me. It makes me feel something I havent felt in a long time: childhood innocence. It reminds me of coming home from a long summer day, my mom is waiting for me at the table with dinner, and waiting to clean off the dirt on my face from playing outside, and a smile on her face. It was those moments where nothing could ever go wrong in such a corrupt world, and that's what Earthbound shows amazingly.
comment4: I come here during the hard and not so hard times. It reminds me of childhood, not a care in the world. Going to sleep excited for the next day. Believing in Santa, in people, believing in fairy tales and lucky charms and... believing in the world. Times like these seem far-gone now, but atleast we have the memories of these things. comment1:
The best part about this song is that it can change depending on what stage of life you’re in. If you’re happy with your life and are living to it’s fullest it can sound depressing and hopeless, but if you are in a position where you feel hopeless or detached from your life it can sound soothing, and can put you back to a moment you felt safe, even if that moment was brief. It all changes depending on perspective and that’s what I love about this piece

Edit: I didn't think some post I made 2 years ago when I had just recently got myself out of a toxic friend group would get so popular. I was in a dark place when I wrote this, and I'm so glad that it has brought people together in such a beautiful way. Whoever you are, wherever you are, keep it up, and one day you'll be able to face the light of tomorrow with hope
comment2: I lost my father the same year this game came out. when I replay the game, this song makes me sad, especially when you play it for Darmani… but it heals me too.
comment3: This song makes me sad. Like a home you can’t quite remember and can never return to....
comment4: it's creepy at first but It gets better later, just shows healing will take time
comment5: This song really embodies the concept of holding space to me. This idea for those who don't know is that instead of trying to cheer somebody up or encourage them or give them hope you just let them share all their sorrows and let out all their pain. You just let them feel all the pain and go through and you just hold up a space for them to let all the pain out.
comment6: Healing can take time. Just know time is a mysterious essence and we are all slaves to time. Time gives us pain, loss, grief, and death... Time also gives us recovery, healing, patience, and soul resurrection. May love stay in your heart and may you always know how to heal♥♥♥
comment7: This song is so therapeutic and somber for me. When I'm sad I listen to this to help me know there is good in my life. And when I need to be sad, this song brings me to tears, it reminds me of all I've lost. It reminds me how to heal. About a month ago today, I ended an abusive friendship, one of the hardest things I've had to do. I knew this person my whole life, but they didn't love me, even if I loved them. So when I listen to this song and think about that time, it helps me to remind myself it takes time to heal. Healing from trauma, loss, depression, anxiety, suicidal thoughts, abusive, and life. Not all scars go away, some stay forever. I know I'm not the only one. I hope one day when I look upon my scars that I do not look on them with only somberness but reminds me of how I've grown, and what I got myself out of.
comment8: "Whenever there is a meeting, a parting shall follow. But that parting needs not last forever. Whether a parting be forever or merely for a short while... that is up to you."
comment9: This song hits harder when you’ve been met with a terrible fate
comment10: My friend Zita (Yvette) passed away this year. This one is for her. She loved The Legend of Zelda ❤
comment11:
This song will forever resonate within me. This is one of those tracks (among many others) I come to whenever I'm feeling a bit down..and the main reason I feel down these days is because my Dad is no longer here. 

This song helps me to remember some happy memories of him. Simple little things like helping him with the grocery shopping and then grabbing a sandwich on the way home and eat and watch a little TV with him before he had to go to work. And of course, my favorite, playing Punch Out Wii together. We liked taking turns going through the circuits and watching each other fight different boxers.

It's bittersweet, but it does help me when times are getting tough. Love you Dad..I really hope there's an afterlife because I want to hug you again old man.
comment12: When my grandfather passed my friends dragged me to a zelda symphony awhile later this played and I literally cried but it was good.. like I felt better while hearing this i felt comfort and closure.. Today I got news about my cousin passing away.. this one hurt so hard, she was younger then me and it just devastated me... this song helps take the pain away and I just think of the good times we had and I'll cherish them forever.
comment13:
When I listen to this, I return to a house, a house out in texas with my mom, sister, and dog, I feel the feeling of waking up early to run to the Wii and resume my play through of Majora’s Mask, back in a simpler time, back when life was good.
I haven’t cried in a while, but if anything is close to bringing me to tears, it’s this song

...and also that I’m wasting my life and such but that’s besides the point
comment14:
I recently lost a member of my family. It was very sudden, and she was perfectly healthy the day before. Or so it seemed. I haven't really let myself feel it because I'm not really in a position where I can lose myself to the pain.

Somehow I knew I needed to listen to this. It's very, very gently pulling out the sadness, and letting me feel it in reasonable amounts.
comment15: This song really calls for healing, a part tells you that you have made mistakes in life that have affected you, but that can be healed and start living a new life!... Make mistakes, heal and start living again.. It's amazing with just the melody I can think of this.

comment1:
This song was my best friends favorite. I didnt play undertale and he was so upset about it, always telling me that I should play it. In the end of 9th grade, he walked up to me and said: "You should play it even when I'll be gone." I thought he said it because he wanted to go to college. Next day his mom called me. Turned out he got stage 4 cancer just before ending the 9th grade. He didnt want to tell me about it for unknown reasons but it's understandable. Immediately after that I played the entire game and wrote a note: "You were right. Miss you." and put it on his balcony. Next day it was gone like he took it. It's been 8 years and this song popped up in my recommendations and I remembered him. Thank you, Toby Fox. And I miss you Brian. I hope you are having fun over there, you are in better place now. 
Edit: thanks y’all for support, I really appreciate that and I’m sure Brian does too.
comment2: This song is sad but happy. It makes me feel emotions that I can’t explain. Right now with the current situation in the world things have been tough for a lot of people, and i guess this song kinda helps me escape all my problems and troubles, even if it’s temporary. Have a good day/night guys. Keep fighting.
comment3: It's already 2023. How fast time flies. It feels like just yesterday I was crying from the end of this game
comment4: This song feels like every emotion ever all at once

comment13: Its like a memory that you try to forget but it still comes back to you.
comment14: My God, this song is beautiful, it is my favorite, I am overwhelmed with emotions! I listen almost every day..) fully describes my life ;)
comment15:
My dog was diagnosed with bone cancer a month ago. She had had it for a while and the doctor said she probably didn't have lone, and my family agreed to put her down if she was suffering. During this period, I would just stay up at night and listen to this and feel a variety of emotions, from fear, to uncomfortable, to sadness and would just let it all out. Exactly seven days later, I was pulled out of class and sent home early and had the opportunity to stay with her for two more hours before she was inevitably euthanized and freed from the chains holding her to this mortal plane. Callie, we miss you dearly and those eight years were full of many moments, both sad and happy. May death do us part but I do hope we can meet again one day, perhaps in a happier situation.

Edit: Thank you all for your kind words. I'm back here as I reminisce on the past year in the final hour before 2023, hard to believe she won't be here for this year. I'll miss her and relistening to this hurts like hell, but she's in a better place now, running around without a care in the world. It's been 2 months as of 1/2/2023 which is honestly hard to believe.

Update: 3/31/2023. It's really crazy that in just about a month, it'll have been half a year. I'm off to High School very soon and that has it's ups and downs but I've recently kept on relistening to this as I've done my yearly replay of UNDERTALE. It gives me a strange feeling, not of great sadness nor fear or uncomfortableness like I once felt. It just feels weird, like as if I've finally moved on from that. It still does make me not happy but not to the extent it did in the past. I feel off and numb when listening to this.

comment1: This song reminds me of whenever it was the last day of me at the hospital, it was feb 2021, probably one of the most traumatizing memories I’ve ever had of any hospital. (Just that hospital) They took me to another room where they were going to remove a tube out my colon, I was listening to this song the entire 50 minutes I was in that room. I still think about that hospital whenever I hear this song
comment2: The hours I’d sit and watch my older sister play this game, while I wanted to play crash bandicoot instead. I’d do anything just for a couple minutes of that
comment3: This song always makes me feel better.
comment4: This is a “coming home after school after a long day of school and turning on your GameCube and playing animal crossing” type of memory
comment5: this song combined with the sound of the rain hitting my roof creates a vibe like no other.

comment12: this is such a warm song to listen too, reminds me of the sun sets of my days as a kid, Simpler times for sure

comment7: you ever just lay back and daydream while listening to music? this one was a favorite.

comment12: I played this game as a little kid... and this song has haunted my dreams for years! Happy to have finally remembered where it came from!
comment13: I was tripping on some good ass L an dwvided to bust out this on gamecube this arena came up it was so euphoric with the music I felt a new sense of heaven
comment14: My brother and I finally beat this game not too long ago. We'd been playing it ever since we got our gamecube when we were children. It was one of the greatest feeling achievements of my life. I'll forever love this song and all of it's beautiful music that had been stuck in my head since the beginning🖤
comment15: Everytime this song comes on all my memories of this game come flooding back, so relaxing

comment1:
I don't get how this soundtrack manages to make me, a 15 year old cry from nostalgia... I just started to play the original super Mario galaxy game again because lately I've been feeling really depressed. I feel like I'm just growing up too fast and I'll never get that time back...

Sorry i wrote this while crying so sorry if it sounds dramatic
comment2: My love for space comes from this game. 15 years ago, I was a little boy playing Super Mario Galaxy in his basement. 15 years later, I am a studying Astrophysicist tracking the movement and behaviors of Supermassive Black Holes at the center of galaxies. And while I study, this playlist is on loop the entire time, reminding me of my undying passion for the cosmos and the mysteries that lie above us.
comment3: To me, this song is more than just a video game OST. Tomorrow morning, I'll be selling my first car. I learned how to drive manual with it. It got me through the pandemic, college, a relationship and 3 jobs. I drove it the entirety of the east coast. I can't think of a more fitting song to play going to the dealership.
comment4: I always cry when I hear this Melody. It just makes me feel life amazing again. Thanks Nintendo.
comment5:
Recently a friend turned 15, and her family hired a violinist, the guy started playing normal music that plays at parties, and then... he started playing this.
It was the most magical moment of my life (and even more magical for my friend lol!!)
comment6: This brings me back to the Christmas after this game came out. I remember Christmas shopping with my parents trying this game out in Walmart with my younger brother.. I remember the wii feeling so futuristic and different. We got the wii with this for Christmas that year and it was one of my favorite memories. My parents are no longer together and my family is pretty spread apart but I loved those times and I’ll definitely always remember them
comment7: i went from playing this game all the time as a kid (still do) to being in the US navy, god time flies. I love nintendo for giving us this masterpiece ❤️
comment8: Chest got tight and faced puffed up, threatening to release tears when this played during The Super Mario Bros Movie's credits. Nostalgia hit hard. I hope that movie produces big in numbers, it was perfect.
comment9: This song is truly perfect. Times like these remind me what it means to be human. Seeing so many souls from so many different paths of life all connect to meet, it truly gives me hope for the future of humanity
comment10: This is the soundtrack of when stress didn't exist. If only i could go back. Maybe one day.....
comment11:
To those that listen to this at night
“May the stars shine down on you”
comment12: When I was little I used to play Mario games. And years later, I watch my son play it. There is a feeling of nostalgia, but also of fullness. I watch him play, and I have the impression of becoming the little girl that I am no longer. Mario is truly timeless. I am sure that in a few years I would watch my grandchildren play it again.
comment13: I remember how magical it was to play this game when I was a kid. I remember not stressing or feeling pain, the only worry I had was making it to school on time. Getting home and playing Mario galaxy in my sisters room is such a strong feeling for me, reminds me of the nights when I would steal her iPod to listen to music and fall asleep. Being more mature and grown has its benefits but living without stress and depression was the best thing ever. If you are young  please enjoy the time you have before you are working a job and dealing with unsurpassable situations and circumstances.
comment14: Let me tell you a short little tale. Flash back to around elementary school. I'm on break for a while and visit my grandma, sleeping in the living room with my brother. We wake up, the sun shining through the window. Excited to play the game more. That single memory has kept me going for a while.
comment15: I don’t want to get emotional but Mario Galaxy really takes me back to times where I wouldn’t worry so much. I’m writing this as someone who’s currently 17 (turning 18 in December) and I understand that I still have my whole life ahead of me.. but sometimes I wish I could just go back to those times. Just for a day or two, to re-experience those happy childhood moments where all I had to worry about was if I was staying up too late while playing, and even then, I never cared.. I’m sorry for the upsetting comment but I just wanted to express how much this game means to me.

comment1:
I’d do anything to be 8-9 years old again hiding my DS under my pillow at night from my mom during school nights whenever she’d make sure I was sleeping... life was amazing and simple then.




Mom always knew what I was doing though bless her heart ❤️
comment2: The first five seconds of this song are permanently seared into my brain. Instant nostalgia...
comment3:
My childhood best friend turned out to be a complete dickhead who ended up ditching me in a messed up way which rly fucked me up. When I first heard this song in 08, I pictured stills of happy memories I had with him and started to ball my eyes out. 

Its been 20 years since I lost that friendhship, and still, whenever I hear the first few notes, I remember, and I cry. The longing to go back, to tell everyone back then that I loved them and goodbye one last time still haunts me, and I;ve accepted that it probably always will. Tell the ppl in your life how you feel, before your last chance to to do passes you by.
comment4:
I have good memories of this song, my cat passed away this week so i came back here to listen that.
I clearly remember of playing Platinum with him in my lap back in the day. i miss him so much 


buddy you still have your side of the bed reserved, ok??
comment5: Everyone here is sad, and nostalgic, and its fine to look back at these times with nostalgia, but try to look at the positives in your life now, and how the past times shaped you to be who you are, and be thankful we grew up on things like this, maybe even play some Pokémon. Spread the positivity :)
comment6: Just the opening of this song makes me cry, those high notes are just so mystical, but there's like a hint of sadness to it. Literally just sounds like what nostalgia would sound like. Such a beautiful song
comment7: Songs like these frighten me because of how fast time flies, how things drastically changed in my life, fear for the future. I won't know if I'll be okay by the next time I hear this song again, but I certainly hope so. Enjoy life, everyone. We only have the here and now.
comment8: For me this is the music that plays in my head whenever I think of my childhood and all the great times, that never come back
comment9: This is one of the best Pokémon songs I have ever heard, and it has changed my life. It just gives a calm and warm feeling in your heart, like you wanna cry. That's what I love about this song.
comment10: I’m so glad to have been born in this time. 1995 was literally the perfect year to have been born in. I couldn’t be more grateful for everything I’ve gotten to experience
comment11: God this song brings me to tears. The nostalgia, the memories of being a kid back in 09 when I first played this game. The freedom of childhood that I’ll never get back. Hearing this in Brilliant Diamond and again in Legends Arceus made me sob. Thank you Pokémon for all the great memories, and for many more.
comment12: "Eterna Forest, where time stands still"
comment13: the comment section of this video hits different... everyone's sharing their experiences and relating them to pokémon and some of them are wholesome, sad, or even both... keep your chin up y'all and keep loving and playing pokémon! this virtual world has been being my comfort zone since my childhood, I love it so much.
comment14: I am writing this on the eve of my 20th birthday. Today is my last day as a teenager. I feel like listening to this is a bittersweet farewell to my childhood. I am very happy that I grew up on this game. Road trips to Disney, and getting to play on the way home from school, or sneaking my dsi underneath my pillow so my grandma, or parents did not catch me. Great times :) I’m glad to read through this comment section to find that there’s many of you who shared similar experiences with me. Much love to you all from Miami, Florida.
comment15:
It's awesome how much this song and Pokémon in general was a part of others peoples lives, as it was a part of mine when growing up.
I can't believe we got blessed with this beautiful music, every time I listen to it I get reminded of when I was a kid, when shit was so much more simple, makes me cry a little bit.

comment1: Ohhhh man the amount of nostalgia wrapped up in this simple little tune. Even tho it brings back good memories it still gives me a sad feeling knowing those moments are gone forever.. Damn time flies too fast
comment2: Crazy how a 1-bit computer generated song with like 90’s tech has more emotion in it than most modern day music lol
comment3: My stepfather LOVED RPG's. I used to sit and watch him go through the game. He loved the Final Fantasy series so much and I did too. Final Fantasy VI and VII were the ones he played a lot. Video games and NASCAR racing were my childhood. This theme always takes me back to those days many years ago, when we were all together again and times were different and simpler.
comment4: I've cried more than once to this song.
comment5: Perfect song for a cold morning with a mild sunrise ahead
comment6: I only played this game for the first time about three years ago so I have little nostalgia associated with it, yet somehow something about the way this song is arranged just brings me back to simpler times of my life
comment7: Listening to this song while in the car driving to my new home. It’s far away from everything I’ve ever known but I know I’ll be alright
comment8: Makes me think about my grandma, I always used to play this game at her house. I just wish I spent more time with her
comment9: I always wonder if the reason FF7 touches me so deeply is just that I played it as an unsuspecting kid. Are 12 year olds just open to a kind of experience that adults aren't? Or is the game just that good? Either way the soundtrack is the best game ost of all time.
comment10: the music and the images make a very emotional and nostalgic ensemble. I played FFVII when it came out in 1997 when I was 11 years old, more than 2 decades later it is still important in my life
comment11: Sitting in my car, while it's raining outside listening to this, going on 10 hours of sleep in the past week, and I almost fell asleep. Thank you for this.
comment12: Some people may think that playing games like that is a waste of time, but I speak english today thanks to them! We didn't have the option to translate yet, and I'm thankful for that!
comment13: As Indonesian, this game really really saved our childhood. Back to 1997-1998, Indonesia, Thailand, and South Korea hit by what it called the first economic crisis in the world of full global economy. Me as a child might feel depresed about the situation, but thanks god I have FFVII to play.
comment14:
I just turned 18 a few weeks ago and I just felt like me life started but it hasn't changed really, I lost a lot of my highschool friends now that I am in college, I barely can talk to my friends. You know it feels like I am not progressing in life, I am not good at anything specific, the college I am going to is not that good and my grades arent helping the fact that I want to transfer, I feel like my parents are disappointed at me everytime especially my dad, I just sometimes think I am just wasting space when i see other people with the same chances I have get so much higher in life and I am here addicted to p**n and not getting anything done, haven't kissed a girl or anything, I just feel like a failure. But you know I still have a lot of time in this earth  I am going to change so I am proud when I look at this and see the dark hole I have claimed out of and I guess I will just write this rn so I can remember later "Being in the bottom is not bad, but staying there is unacceptable".
